name: Chelidonium majus
Relationship: Complementary: Lycop.; Bryon.Compare: Nux; Sulph.; Bry.; Lyc.; Opium; Podophyl.; Sanguin.; Ars.Antidote: Chamomile.Chelidonin. - (Spasm of smooth muscle everywhere, intestinal colic, uterine colic, bronchial spasm, tachycardia, etc.) Boldo - Boldoa fragrans - (Bladder atony; cholecystitis and biliary calculus. Bitter taste, no appetite; constipation, hypochondriasis languor, congestion of liver, burning weight in liver and stomach. Painful hepatic diseases. Disturbed liver following malaria.) Elemuy Gauteria - (Stone in kidneys and bladder; grain doses of powdered bark in water or 5 drops of tincture. Pellagra).Sulph. often completes its work.

Eyes: Orbital neuralgia of right eye, with profuse lachrymation; pupils contracted, relieved by pressure
Respiratory: Small lumps of mucus fly from mouth when coughing
Short, exhausting cough; sensation of dust not relieved by cough
Very quick and short inspirations; pain on deep inspiration
Pain in right side of chest and shoulder, with embarrassed respiration
Whooping-cough; spasmodic cough; loose, rattling; expectoration difficult
Stomach: Eating relieves temporarily, especially when accompanied with hepatic symptoms
Pain through stomach to back and right shoulder-blade
Tongue yellow, with imprint of teeth; large and flabby
Nausea, vomiting; better, very hot water
Head: Right-sided headache down behind ears and shoulder-blade
Icy coldness of occiput from the nape of neck; feels heavy as lead
Heavy, lethargic; drowsiness very marked, with general numbness; vertigo, associated with hepatic disturbance
Inclination to fall forward
Neuralgia over right eye, right cheek-bone and right ear, with excessive lachrymation, preceded by pain in liver
Urine: Profuse, foaming, yellow urine, like beer
Stool: Constipation; stools hard, round balls, like sheep's dung, bright yellow, pasty; clay-colored, stools float in water; alternation of diarrhoea and constipation
Back: Pain at lower angle of left scapula
Fixed pain under inner and lower angle of right scapula
Stiff neck, head drawn to left
Female: Menses too late and too profuse
Skin: Dry heat of skin; itches, yellow
Abdomen: Jaundice due to hepatic and gall-bladder obstruction
Constriction across, as by a string
Extremities: Pain in arms, shoulders, hands, tips of fingers
Rheumatic pain in hips and thighs; intolerable pains in heels, as if pinched by too narrow a shoe; worse, right
Icy coldness of tips of fingers; wrists sore, tearing in metacarpal bones
Paresis of the lower limbs with rigidity of muscles

details: A prominent liver remedy, covering many of the direct reflex symptoms of diseased conditions of that organ. The jaundiced skin, and especially the CONSTANT PAIN UNDER INFERIOR ANGLE OF RIGHT SCAPULA, are certain indications. Paralytic drawing and lameness in single parts. The great general lethargy and indisposition to make any effort is also marked. Ailments brought on or renewed by change of weather. SEROUS EFFUSIONS. HYDROCELE. BILIOUS COMPLICATIONS DURING GESTATION.
